original_title: Sri Lanka rupee closes at 306.50/308 to the US dollar, bond yields up
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka bonds closed higher on Wednesday, dealers said and the spot closed stronger at 306.50/308 rupees to the US dollar.
Sri Lanka’s banks and financial markets will be closed on Friday June 30 with Thursday (Hajj) and Monday (Poya Day) also statutory holidays.

“The domestic debt optimization has been discussed with the finance ministry and central bank and has come to the final stage,” Central Bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe told reporters earlier this week.

“To implement it cabinet approval, parliament committees like on public finance and other committees need time to discuss it. When June 30 is a bank holiday there is a 5-day period to complete this process.”
A bond maturing on 15.09.2027 closed at 25.25/26.00 percent, up from 24.00/75 percent on Tuesday. (Colombo/ June 28/2023)
